entry.title: Game: Lego Marvel Super Heroes (WiiU, 2013) (7)
entry.content:
Game: Lego Marvel Super Heroes (WiiU, 2013) (7)20140808
We played the X-Men level today. I really like the X-Men, they
seem totally different than other super-heroes to me. I like the
mechanics of Jean Grey and her missile attacks are also great. It
was a pretty tight level.

Total time: 8:41

entry.title: Buffy & Angel - Season 5 - Episode 17 - Forever
entry.content:
Buffy & Angel - Season 5 - Episode 17 - Forever20140808
It's kind of cool that Joss can re-hash the classic
unwanted-Zombie story and make it so good. I like Spike's
approach to Dawn.

Buffy-bot is great in this episode and Spike is so great for

entry.title: Buffy & Angel - Season 5 - Episode 19 - Tough Love
entry.content:
Buffy & Angel - Season 5 - Episode 19 - Tough Love20140808
Glory is so creepy! What happens to Tara is so sad. Dawn's
soliloquy to Spike is great. And it's so awesome how Willow
becomes "Dark Magic Willow". The end is INSANE!
  • TV Shows
  • Buffy & Angel

entry.content:
Buffy & Angel - Season 5 - Episode 20 - Spiral20140808
I like that Spike is so "obviously" on the team for Buffy. This
episode is chock-full of stuff!

entry.title: Buffy & Angel - Season 5 - Episode 21 - The Weight of the World
entry.content:
Buffy & Angel - Season 5 - Episode 21 - The Weight of the World20140808
It's cool how Willow just takes charge. The discussion between
Ben and Glory is priceless.
  • TV Shows
  • Buffy & Angel

entry.title: Buffy & Angel - Season 5 - Episode 22 - The Gift
entry.content:
Buffy & Angel - Season 5 - Episode 22 - The Gift20140808
This is an amazing episode with great lines.

Anya is so chipper: "Here to help, want to live!"

The bunny that Anya sees and their proposal. Anya is so great. I
am so annoyed with what Xander will do next season.

This is a great exchange:
Buffy: "I'm counting on you to protect her."
Spike: "To the end of the world."

When "Ripper" comes out against Ben... yikes!

I love her tombstone: She saved the world a lot.
  • TV Shows
  • Buffy & Angel

entry.title: Game: Lego Marvel Super Heroes (WiiU, 2013) (6)
entry.content:
Game: Lego Marvel Super Heroes (WiiU, 2013) (6)20140807
We played a level today and got introduced to Thor. He's a fun

voice actor and the way they integrated his music.

entry.title: Buffy & Angel - Season 5 - Episode 14A - The Thin Dead Line
entry.content:
Buffy & Angel - Season 5 - Episode 14A - The Thin Dead Line20140807
The third eye thing was very goofy and the whole "Zombie Racist
Cop" plot is weird. I like how common demons and magical things
are in the world of Angel. I also really like Kate and find it
too bad that she can't be more part of the team. After watching
this episode, my wife decided that she didn't like Angel as
much. I like them both, but I definitely like Buffy more.
  • TV Shows
  • Buffy & Angel

entry.title: Buffy & Angel - Season 5 - Episode 15 - I Was Made to Love You
entry.content:
Buffy & Angel - Season 5 - Episode 15 - I Was Made to Love You20140807
Xander and Anya's dialogue in this episode were a hoot. When
Giles told off Spike... yikes! That was a "Ripper" moment. The
fact that April and Buffy had a conversation is so
priceless. It's fun too that Joyce got some really funny lines in
moments in this last episode as a living character. Brutal way to
end it though.
  • TV Shows
  • Buffy & Angel

entry.title: Buffy & Angel - Season 5 - Episode 16 - The Body
entry.content:
Buffy & Angel - Season 5 - Episode 16 - The Body20140807
This is an amazing episode. I like the way that Willow reacts to
going... it reminds me of How to Deal. Anya, the character that
always tells the truth, has some great moments too. The vampire
at the end is pretty great too because it pulls you back into the
fantastic world. Yikes.
  • TV Shows
  • Buffy & Angel

entry.title: Book: The Fault in Our Stars, by John Green (2012)
entry.content:
Book: The Fault in Our Stars, by John Green (2012)20140807
I'll be starting this today with my wife. My little sister and
cousins have been reading it and I've been watching the Greens for
years, so it is exciting to finally read something of John's.

--

I read it basically in one single sitting. It was really
entertaining. The dialogue was great and the story was so cute. It
felt just sophisticated enough to be accessible and I loved some of
the metaphors. It felt very real and I thought the ending was world
class. I'm very excited for the movie.
  • Books
  • 2012

entry.title: Book: Lady Susan, by Jane Austen (1794)
entry.content:
Book: Lady Susan, by Jane Austen (1794)20140806
I read this today. I don't really like these epistolary novels
because it's very hard to remember who the characters are, where
they are, who is speaking, etc, because it is just barely mentioned
at the beginning of each letter.
  • Books
  • 1794

entry.title: Book: Capital in the Twenty-First Century, by Thomas Piketty (2014) (2)
entry.content:
Book: Capital in the Twenty-First Century, by Thomas Piketty (2014) (2)20140806
I'm in the process of reading the Introduction and I find the
author extremely aggravating. His focus on data and the way he
writes about it betrays a sense that there is no explanation for
capital accumulation and that there are no principles at work. The
way he lovingly writes about Marx is upsetting too.

I am also annoyed that he raises "income inequality" as a dangerous
specter without any explanations of why it is a bad thing. But
that's just another way of saying that I am deontologist and he is
a consequentialist.

When he discusses the Kuznets Curve, he employs ad-hominem attack
on the way the paper was given rather than arguing with its
content. :(

After reading the Introduction, I don't think I will dig into the
details. I feel a little bad to ignore something that offends my
sensibilities, but apart from the conclusions, the details seem to
be minutely tailored for experts in the field and I only have so
much time in life.
  • Books
  • 2014

entry.title: Buffy & Angel - Season 5 - Episode 12 - Checkpoint
entry.content:
